get.summary: Get the service capabilities
get.description: Returns the JSON consisting of lists of extractable fields, enrichment and document types that the service is         capable of processing.

get.summary: Retrieve all client names and IDs that are accessible by the caller
get.description: Returns all the client details as a list in the **`payload`** key in the returned JSON.

parameters.description: Filters the list of clients by the characters the id starts with.
parameters.name: clientIdStartsWith

parameters.description: Index of the first client to be retrieved. Example: 10
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Number of clients to retrieve (maximum allowed value: 50000). Example: 10
parameters.name: limit

delete.description: Returns an error if any of the specified client IDs does not exist.

post.summary: Create one or more clients
post.description:
To create a client, two parameters must be specified: **`clientId`** and **`clientName`**. The list of clients         to be created must be sent as a JSON payload in the request.

### Examples for payload parameter:
Single client: `{"value":[{"clientId":"c_00","clientName":"client 00"}]}`
Multiple clients: `{"value":[{"clientId":"c_00","clientName":"client 00"},         {"clientId":"c_01","clientName":"client 01"}]}`

### Field values:
- The spaces at the beginning and the end of the value strings are removed.

get.summary: Get all configurations for the requested scope

parameters.description: Scope of the configuration. If left empty, default scope is 'active'.
parameters.name: scope

parameters.description: The client to set the configuration for. Only used for client scope configuration.
parameters.name: clientId

parameters.description: Tenant to get configurations for. Defaults to the tenant sending the request.
parameters.name: tenantId

delete.summary: Delete configurations on the given scope according to the given payload
delete.description:
Accepts an array of keys in the payload for configurations to be deleted.
If an empty array is given, all configurations will be deleted.

parameters.description: Scope of the configuration. If left empty, default scope is 'tenant'.
parameters.name: scope

parameters.description: The client to set the configuration for. Only used for client scope configuration.
parameters.name: clientId

parameters.description: Tenant to which the configuration change is applied. Defaults to the tenant sending the request.
parameters.name: tenantId

post.summary: Create or update configurations based on the given payload
post.description:
Configurations can be set on tenant, instance
or client level.

parameters.name: scope

parameters.description: The client to set the configuration for. Only used for client scope configuration.
parameters.name: clientId

parameters.description: Tenant to which the configuration change is applied. Defaults to the tenant sending the request.
parameters.name: tenantId

parameters.name: scope

parameters.description: The client to set the configuration for. Only used for client scope configuration.
parameters.name: clientId

parameters.description: Tenant to get configurations for. Defaults to the tenant sending the request.

parameters.description:
Key must be one of the following predefined keys: ['performPIICheck',
 'clientSegregation',
 'manualDataActivation',
 'coordinateFormat',
 'activateDocumentNotifications',
 'dataFeedbackCollection',
 'documentRetentionTimeDays',
 'enrichmentConfidenceThreshold']

get.summary: Get configurations for the requested key and the requested scope
Retrieve one or more data entities that match the provided query
get.description: Returns a JSON response with previously uploaded data entities, which match the provided query. If a single         entity matches the query, the response will contain only one entity, otherwise the response will be a list of         entities.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of data which is handled(employee, businessEntity, product)

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The ID of the client. Example: clientId = c_00

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The data ID of a single entry

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the first item to be returned. Example: 10

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Items per page. Defines a maximum. Example: 10

parameters.name: subtype
parameters.description: The subtype of data either supplier, customer, companyCode for business entity.

parameters.name: system
parameters.description: The system of the a single entry.

parameters.name: companyCode
parameters.description: The company code of the a single entry.

post.summary: Create a data activation job record

parameters.description: Type of data which is handled(employee, businessEntity, product)
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: The subtype of data either supplier, customer, companyCode for business entity.
parameters.name: subtype

parameters.description: The ID returned by `[POST]/data/activation` endpoint. Example: 29812f26-464e-4ee6-be63-731859cf99f3
parameters.name: id

get.summary: Give a data persistence job ID to check the database and receive information on this data activation job
get.description:
This endpoint will return a JSON with the status and processed time of the data activation job specified by
the given ID

get.summary: Retrieve a list of all data-persistence jobs for this tenant
get.description: Supports additional filtering by client & job status and sorting by creation date, client & job status.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of this data-persistence job. Possible values: ['PENDING', 'SUCCESS', 'FAILED']

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The ID of the client. Example: clientId = c_00

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the first item to be returned. Example: 10

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Items per page. Defines a maximum. Example: 10

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Ordering criterion for the retrieved data-persistence jobs (possible values: status, client, created). Example: created asc

422.description: Unprocessable Entity. Size of entity exceeds request limit of 10000.

delete.summary: Perform the asynchronous deletion of existing data entities for the specified fields
delete.description: Performs the deletion of existing data entities for the specified fields. It accepts an array of IDs in the         payload that should be deleted. If no array is given, all entries will be deleted. It is required to use this         asynchronous endpoint for larger amounts of records, but it is recommended to use it for small amounts as well.

parameters.description: Type of data which is handled(employee, businessEntity, product)
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: The ID of the client. Example: clientId = c_00
parameters.name: clientId

parameters.description: The subtype of data either supplier, customer, companyCode for business entity.
parameters.name: subtype

422.description: Unprocessable Entity. Size of entity exceeds request limit of 10000.

post.summary: Create or update one or more data entities
post.description:
Allows the asynchronous creation and update of data entities for a specified client ID. A request must contain         a valid JSON string as the payload parameter, which typically contains a list of multiple records of the same         data type. The result returned by this endpoint is the ID of the data persistence job responsible for         uploading/updating the data. This ID can be used in the GET /data endpoint to retrieve the current status of         the data persistence job.
The two data types that can be submitted are:
- businessEntity - Has subtype of supplier, customer, companyCode or unspecified.
- employee - Has no specified subtype.

In the payload JSON string, a mandatory field of ID must be provided for each data record for businessEntity         and employee.

### Examples for payload parameter:
**businessEntity**: `{"value": [{"id":"BE0001", "name":"","accountNumber":"", "address1":"", "address2": "",         "city":"", "countryCode":"", "postalCode":"","state":"", "email":"", "phone":"",         "bankAccount":"", "taxId":""}]}`

**employee**: `{"value": [{"id":"E0001", "email":"", "firstName":"", "middleName": "", "lastName":""}]}`

parameters.description: Type of data which is handled(employee, businessEntity, product)
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: The ID of the client. Example: clientId = c_00
parameters.name: clientId

parameters.description: The subtype of data either supplier, customer, companyCode for business entity.
parameters.name: subtype

parameters.description: The ID returned by `[POST/DELETE]/data/jobs` endpoint. Example: 29812f26-464e-4ee6-be63-731859cf99f3
parameters.name: id

get.summary: Return information about a data persistence job
get.description: Takes a data persistence job ID as input and returns a JSON with the status and processing time of the         corresponding data persistence job.

post.summary: Post a search/filter request to get the current status of document processing jobs
post.description:
Returns a list with all document processing jobs as JSON.
Optionally, the jobs can be filtered based on the client ID and a filter query.
Catalog options:
- pagination using limit and offset
- ordering using order
- filtering using filters

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
Catalog options used when searching for documents.
- `clientId`: The ID of the client used while submitting the document. Example: c_00
- `limit`: Number of documents to retrieve (maximum allowed value: 200). Example: 10
- `offset`: Index of the first document to be retrieved. Example: 20
- `order`: Ordering criterion for the retrieved documents (possible values: created, fileName, documentType, status). Example: created asc
- `likeFilter`: Filter query for retrieving documents that uses the LIKE operator. The expression should follow the format "fieldName like value". Supported fields are: fileName. Example: "fileName like "test receipt""
- `filter`: Filter query for retrieving documents. The filter query needs to be an expression. The expression should follow the format "fieldName op value <AND/OR> fieldName op value". Supported fields are: documentType, created, status, customLabel, reviewStatus, tenantId, jobId. Possible operators (op) depend on the field. Example: "status eq done"
parameters.default:
{
  "clientId": "c_00",
  "limit": 10,
  "offset": 2,
  "order": "created desc",
  "likeFilter": "fileName like \"test receipt\"",
  "filter": "status eq failed or documentType eq invoice"
}

get.summary: Get the current status of document processing jobs
get.description: Returns a list with all document processing jobs as JSON. Optionally, the jobs can be filtered based on the         client ID.

parameters.description: The ID of the client used while submitting the document. Example: c_00
parameters.name: clientId

delete.summary: Delete one or more documents and all related data
delete.description: Performs the deletion of a list of documents and all related data like extracted field values and ground         truth. The payload is an optional array of IDs that will be deleted. If this parameter is not present, all         documents will be deleted.

post.summary: Submit a document for processing
post.description: Performs a document submission (e.g a **pdf**, **png** or **jpeg** file) for asynchronous processing. Returns         a document job ID if the document is submitted successfully. This ID can be used with other endpoints like         GET /document/jobs/{id} and DELETE /document/jobs/{id}.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The document you wish to submit for processing

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
Options for processing the document.
- `headerFields`: List of header fields to be extracted from the submitted invoice.
- `lineItemFields`: List of line item fields to be extracted from the submitted invoice.
- `clientId`: The ID of the client. Example: 'c_00'
- `documentType`: The type of document being uploaded. Choices: 'invoice', 'paymentAdvice', 'purchaseOrder', 'businessCard', 'deliveryNote', 'resume', 'birthCertificate'
- `schemaName`/`schemaId`: The  name or ID of the schema to be used for this document. Either one of _schemaName_, _schemaId_ or _extraction_ field  must be provided but not multiple.
- `schemaVersion`: The version number of the schema to be used for this document. In  the payload, _schemaId_ or _schemaName_ must be provided. If _schemaVersion_ is not provided default version 1 will  be used.
- `receivedDate`: The date at which the document was received. Example: '2020-02-17'
- `customLabel`: The label customer wants to use for the document. This is optional. If used, we can  query the corresponding document ID using the _POST /document/catalog_ endpoint.
- `templateId`: The ID of the template to be used for this document. If _templateId_ is set, also  _schemaId_ or _schemaName_ must be provided. To detect templateId automatically, use the value  'detect' instead of the ID string.
- `candidateTemplateIds`: IDs of templates from which the service automatically detects the  appropriate templateId.
- `enrichment`: Activate matching and define number of results and types.
The ID returned when a document is submitted via **`[POST]/document/jobs`** endpoint. Example: 4476cc01-72f3-4b64-9eb0-cdd9c1cb27ff
parameters.name: id

get.summary: Retrieve the results of a document previously submitted for all requested fields
get.description: Takes the job ID of a previously submitted document and returns the corresponding processing results, or an         error, if the given ID was not found.

parameters.description: Set to true to return all fields and line items, even if no value could be found. The default behavior is to not return these null value fields.
parameters.name: returnNullValues

parameters.description: Set to true to fetch the extracted values. Set to false to fetch the ground truth values if available; if ground truth values are not available, extracted values will be returned in any case. The default value is false. I.e. By default the system returns the ground truth with higher priority.
parameters.name: extractedValues

post.summary: Save the ground truth (correct values for document fields) for the specified document job ID
post.description:
Takes the job ID of a document submitted previously and returns the corresponding processing results, or an         error, if the given ID was not found.
Only the fields of a document (header fields and line item fields) and the enrichment data should be part of
the payload aside from the document ID since they are the only fields relevant for the ground truth.
For the fields, the following attributes are part of the ground truth:
    - name (required)
    - value (required)
    - rawValue (optional)
    - page (optional)
    - coordinates (optional)
For enrichment data, the following attributes are relevant for the ground truth:
    - id (required)

parameters.description: ID to identify the document
parameters.name: id

post.summary: Set document status to confirmed
post.description:
Takes the job ID of a document and sets the document status to confirmed. Once a document is confirmed, it
cannot be changed anymore (e.g. no more upload of ground truth will be possible).

post.summary: Create or update a template
post.description:
If an ID (template ID) is not provided, a template ID is generated and returned.
If an ID (template ID) is provided, but it is not in the system, a new record with template ID provided
is created.
If an ID (template ID) is provided, and it is in the system, an update of record with same template ID
is executed.

post.summary: Set metadata fields of a template
post.description:
Payload parameter:
- name(required): schema field name
- value(optional): fixed value for header field, fixed value is only applicable to header fields and will be         ignored for line item fields. Default is null
- extraction(optional): specify the extractor for the field, allow value are 'template' and 'schema'.         Default is 'template'
- isLineItemField(optional): should be 'true' if field is a line item field. Default is 'false'

parameters.description: The ID of the client
parameters.name: clientId

info.title: SAP Document AI (Version 1)
info.description: SAP Document AI helps you process large numbers of business documents containing a wide variety of content and structures. After you upload a document file to SAP Document AI, it extracts data across different sections and layouts, regardless of how the information is organized within the document.
info.termsOfService: All data uploaded by end users through these APIs is considered “User Content” under the Terms of Use. SAP may use such data without restriction, including, without limitation, for developing data mining techniques, machine learning algorithms and software code that may be incorporated into SAP products and services.

message.example: No Authorization given in the request header

extraction.description: Extractable fields along with associated datatypes

documentTypes.description: Document types that can be processed using SAP Document AI

enrichment.description: Fields extracted from various types of documents along with supported documents for each field

message.example: The parameter must be an integer.

 'dataFeedbackCollection',
 'documentRetentionTimeDays',
 'enrichmentConfidenceThreshold']

 'clientSegregation',
 'manualDataActivation',
 'coordinateFormat',
 'activateDocumentNotifications',
 'dataFeedbackCollection',
 'documentRetentionTimeDays',
 'enrichmentConfidenceThreshold'].
Value: a non-empty string.
